results.creator_credit: Ernest Thompson, Bill Badalato, Daniel Grodnik and Atlantic Productions
results.brief_description: It was the end of high school and nearing the end of an era when teenage friends Scott (Kiefer Sutherland) and Ralph (Robert Downey Jr) face the full brunt of events in society at the time - the war in Vietnam, Neil Armstrong walking on the moon, and a boom in hippie culture. Scott, a pacifist, has a brother in Vietnam and clashes with his father over his views. Ralph seems to be avoiding the issue through drugs - much to the chagrin of Scott, and Scott’s younger sister, Beth (Winona Ryder), who takes on a bigger role in their lives. In the space of one Summer, two families are drawn together by love, death and war, changing their relationship to one another and society irrevocably. Features a soundtrack of classic 60’s music. Cast also includes Bruce Dern and Mariette Hartley.

results.title: Tetsuo: the iron man
results.brief_description: This film has lent itself to comparison with the work of Lynch and Cronenberg, as it tells its story using a violent array of flashbacks, fast-forwards and nightmarish dream sequences. The action centres around a young metal fetishist who tries to insert pieces of metal into his own skin. Running out into the street he is knocked down by a car and the accident gives him strange powers as his body begins to painfully mutate into a synergy of flesh and metal. Meanwhile the salaryman who ran him down finds his own body is also transforming into a metallic monster. This bizarre, sexual fantasy mixes black humour and sexual imagery with a hypnotic post-industrial soundtrack. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Last days of disco [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Whit Stillman, Westerly Films and Castle Rock
results.brief_description: It is the very early 1980s. Alice (Chloe Sevigny) and Charlotte (Kate Beckinsale) are two ambitious publishing assistants who transform themselves into glamourous disco queens and spend their nights dancing at The Club. That is until their disco-world is turned upside down by a seemingly bisexual lothario, Des (Chris Eigeman), whose involvement with drugs lands him and his money-siphoning friends in trouble with the law. A hilarious tale of tangled romances, friendship and music you just can’t stop dancing to!

results.title: Short cuts [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Cary Brokaw and Short Cuts Productions Inc
results.brief_description: A dazzling and dizzying adaptation of short stories by Raymond Carver, “Short Cuts” follows 22 Los Angeles residents whose lives intersect over the course of a few days. Anne and Howard Finnegan are preparing for their son’s birthday when the boy falls into a coma after a car accident. Meanwhile, Andy the baker, seethes with anger over the birthday cake that wasn’t claimed. Lois is a new mother who watches over her baby when not making money doing phone sex. Pilot “Stormy” Weathers takes a very literal approach to dividing up property with his ex-wife. Doreen is trying to hold on to her marriage with Earl, who is a good man on the rare occasions that he’s sober. Zoe, a classical musician, is trying to find a way to connect with her jazz singer mother. Dr. Ralph Wyman and wife, Marian, put their bickering on hold while they have dinner with couple, Stuart and Claire Kane. The stories wind around each other with just enough connecting threads to hold the tapestry together. Cast includes: Anne Archer, Bruce Davison, Peter Gallagher, Buck Henry, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Jack Lemmon, Huey Lewis, Lyle Lovett, Andie MacDowell, Matthew Modine, Julianne Moore, Chris Penn, Tim Robbins, Annie Ross, Lori Singer, Madeleine Stowe, Lili Tomlin, Tom Waits, Fred Ward, Lili Taylor, Frances McDormand and Robert Downey Jr.

results.title: Empire of passion = Ai no Borei = Phantom of love
results.creator_credit: Nagisa Oshima, Anatole Dauman, Argos Films and Oshima Productions
results.brief_description: Following the world-wide success of his highly erotic and controversial ‘Ai No Corrida’ (The Realm of the Senses) in 1976, Oshima directed a companion piece, ‘Empire of Passion’, but this time set in late 19th century rural Japan. Toyoji (Tatsuya Fuji), a soldier, returns from the first Chinese War and embarks on a passionate affair with Seki (Kazuko Yoshiyuki), a woman twenty years his senior and married to a hard-drinking rickshaw man. They soon conspire to murder the husband and throw his body down a disused well. Three years later, the husband’s ghost returns to haunt the lovers, thus hastening their downfall. Like much of Oshima’s work the film is based on facts. It also follows Oshima’s defiant stance against Japan’s strict censorship laws and moral codes. However, ‘Ai No Borei’ is less concerned with steamy eroticism than the aftermath of an all consuming passion, namely the devastating effect of guilt. ‘Ai No Borei’ is a straight forward crime of passion story in the vein of ‘The Postman Always Rings Twice’ with the added thrill of an Asian ghost story. Adapted from a novel by Itoko Namura, ‘Ai No Borei’ is also known as ‘Phantom of Love’. Nagisa Oshima was awarded the Best Director Prize at the Cannes Film Festival in 1978. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Blue lamp
results.creator_credit: Basil Dearden, Michael Relph and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: This police drama shows how Ealing’s wartime mix of social purpose and fictional realism, centred on the idea of a national community, was extended into postwar concerns. Although this is a ‘social problem’ drama (the problem of transgressing delinquent youth), the ‘daydream of universal benevolence’ as Barr calls it, strongly links ‘The Blue Lamp’ to the Ealing comedies scripted by Clarke. The police are presented as a professional family. Society, including the professional underworld, closes ranks against the postwar excrescence of delinquency represented by the violent, hysterical, irresponsible and overtly sexual Riley. Reference: Charles Barr, Ealing Studios, Cameron & Tayleur, London, 1977. Cast includes Jack Warner, James Hanley, Bernard Lee and Dirk Bogarde. Based on a story by Ted Willis and Jan Read.

results.title: The Sleeping tiger
results.brief_description: Directed by Joseph Losey in 1954, “The Sleeping Tiger” was his first feature made in Britain which came to typify what was later referred to as, ‘Losey Baroque’. In this domestic drama, criminal Frank Clements (Dirk Bogarde) becomes a ‘home-trial’ case patient for psychologist, Dr. Clive Esmond (Alexander Knox) and inadvertently his wife, Glenda (Alexis Smith). Forced to undergo psychoanalytic reform in place of a prison sentence, Frank proceeds to provoke emotional conflict in all their relationships. Frank with his excessive passions, and Clive with his emotionally detached approach provide great shadow plays. As Freudian displacement eventuates the themes of disaffection, frustration and alienation spark dramatic changes in all their lives. Dr. Esmond.” In the dark forest of every human personality there is a sleeping tiger.” Who will be freed from their compulsions? Based on the book of the same name by Maurice Moiseiwitsch.

results.title: Point blank
results.creator_credit: John Boorman, Judd Bernard and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based on Donald E. Westlake’s novel “The Hunter”, Lee Marvin stars as an amoral and apathetic antihero in this stylish landmark thriller. Walker (Marvin) is a professional criminal who helps pull off an underworld heist, then is double-crossed, gunned down and left for dead on deserted Alcatraz Island. But he resurface in Los Angeles to track down his share of the loot. Aided by an accomplice (Angie Dickinson), he takes on the syndicate at it’s own deadly game, doggedly stalking his prey across the ever-changing backdrop of seething ‘60s L.A. The trail piles twist upon twist as it leads Walker to a cunning mobman (Carroll O’Connor) and a surprise ending. Remade in 1999 as “Payback” starring Mel Gibson.

results.title: Besieged
results.creator_credit: Bernardo Bertolucci, Massimo Cortesi and Fiction
results.brief_description: In Rome, reclusive British composer Jason Kinsky lives in the building he inherited from his aunt, while his cleaning woman Shandurai resides in the basement, studying medicine. One day, Kinsky tells Shandurai that he loves her and will do anything for her, so she asks him to free her husband, a political prisoner back in Africa. To acquire funds for the man’s release, Kinsky begins selling his possessions, including his piano. Cast includes: Thandie Newton, David Thewlis and Claudio Santamaria.

results.title: It's my party
results.creator_credit: Randal Kleiser, Harry Knapp and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Nick Stark (Eric Roberts) is a Los Angeles architect who has it all - graced with vitality, good looks, loyal friends, a thriving career, a down-to-earth attitude and an irreverent sense of humor. Although he looks healthy, he has been fighting off AIDS related illnesses for years, and he discovers that he has untreatable brain lesions which will, at best, decimate all his brain faculties within days and he may die within a week. He intends to savour his remaining time by gathering everyone he loves for a two-day farewell party. Nick is a generous host to the diverse crowd he attracts. He draws his guests into a highly charged atmosphere where opinions collide, secrets spill, and old wounds heal as everyone struggles to accept Nick’s fate.

He draws his guests into a highly charged atmosphere where opinions collide, secrets spill, and old wounds heal as everyone struggles to accept Nick’s fate.
